questions.question_text:
Your company has a Microsoft 365 subscription.

All the users in the finance department own personal devices that run iOS or Android. All the devices are enrolled in Microsoft Intune.

The finance department adds new users each month.

The company develops a mobile application named App1 for the finance department users.

You need to ensure that only the finance department users can download App1.

What should you do first?

discussion.content:
Correct.

Android: https://developer.android.com/work/managed-configurations

Apple: https://developer.apple.com/library/archive/samplecode/sc2279/Introduction/Intro.html

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

discussion.content:
As my view, 

User1 is member of Group 1 & 2. The Priority of policy, Group 1 is upper than Group 2, the result is .ods. =Yes
User2 is member of Group 2 but Group 2 is under Group 1. The Priority of policy, Group 1 is upper than Group 2, the result is .ods. =No
User3 is memebr of Group 3 but Group 3 is under Group 1. Only Policy 1 can applied. the result is .ods. =No.

please advise if incorrect.

comments.content: I agree. Microsoft ranges priority from 0 - 1000. Priority 0 is greater than priority 1.
But the 2nd part of the question is not asking about .ods, it is asking about .xlsb...

Configurations with lower priority will take precedence.
As Group1 includes Group2 and Group3 as well, always the policy for Group1 will prevail.

ADAM, you are wrong
O has higher priority than 1.

"A lower priority value indicates a higher priority (0 is the highest)"
you have two plicies in intune that is setup to configure Excel. Policy A has a priority of 0. Policy b has a priority of 1 . if A and B conflict, which policy gets priority ?

It would be best if you saw as well Policy priority I presume. User 1 is a member of both groups but policy 1 has priority 0 policy 2 will overtake so it will not save as per policy1.
and same will be with other users Policy 2 will overtake policy 1 in my understanding.

discussion.content:
The key to this question is "If the user is a member of multiple Microsoft Entra groups with conflicting policy settings, priority is used to determine which policy setting is applied."

So in this case, Policy1 will always be applied to all 3 users.

Tricky one. So, in the case of nested groups, Entra evaluates policies based on the userâ€™s direct and indirect group memberships. The policy with the highest priority (lowest numerical value) among all applicable policies will be applied, regardless of whether the group is a direct or nested group. Answer: YNN

I choose:
Y
N
N

YNN

Priority 0 is higher than Priority 1
Group 2 and 3 are part of Group 1
Policy 1 would take precedence for all users, evertime.
All users would be required to save their files in the ODS file format.
YNN IS CORRECT

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/security/office-365-security/safe-links-policies-configure?view=o365-worldwide#use-the-microsoft-365-defender-portal-to-set-the-priority-of-custom-safe-links-policies SO 0 is high priority so YES NO NO
anyone can explain me the Q1 is "Yes", the Policy 1 should be applied in the higher priority 0?

comments.content:
On second thought: That would be true for user2 if there were more policies assigned to group2 directly. But User2 is receiving Policy1 by inheritance of group1. So in this case Policy2 which is assigned to group2 takes precedence.

According to that same article in the link that yoha1558 posted: "Safe Links protection stops for a recipient after the first policy is applied (the highest priority policy for that recipient)."

So I think the answer should be:
Y
Y
N

Policy 2 does not take precedence. 

"If the user is a member of multiple Microsoft Entra groups with conflicting policy settings, PRIORITY is used to determine which policy setting is applied. The highest priority is applied, with "0" being the highest priority that you can assign. You can set the priority by choosing Reorder priority on the Policy configurations page"

AND 
"If users are located in nested groups and the parent group is targeted for policies, the users in the nested groups will receive the policies. The nested groups and the users in those nested groups must be created in or synchronized to Microsoft Entra ID."

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/deployoffice/admincenter/overview-cloud-policy#requirements-for-using-the-office-cloud-policy-service

Note: In the question states that both group2 and group3 are members of group1. That being said: Both policies ultimately apply to all users in this example. And by default, the lower number of priority is the highest. ex: if you have 0, 1, 2. Then 0 is Higher in priority than 1.

In this example, the policy that takes precedence over all three users is policy 1 with priority 0. Therefore all users save the files as .ods format. Then the answer is:

Y
N
N

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft 365 tenant that contains the devices shown in the following table.

//IMG//


The devices are managed by using Microsoft Intune.

You create a compliance policy named Policy1 and assign Policy1 to Group1. Policy1 is configured to mark a device as Compliant only if the device security settings match the settings specified in the policy.

You discover that devices that are not members of Group1 are shown as Compliant.

You need to ensure that only devices that are assigned a compliance policy can be shown as Compliant. All other devices must be shown as Not compliant.

What should you do from the Microsoft Intune admin center?

discussion.content: Turn "Mark devices with no compliance policy assigned as" to "Not compliant"

seems correct
